1.content:
It is the year 2800, mankind has spread through the galaxy, without a single encounter of any other intelligent life forms. Only uninhabited planets and ruins of ancient civilizations. In the midst of this rush for colonization, many Earth Corporation have sent their fleets to the most obscure sectors of the universe, each trying to find something that could help them in beating their adversaries.

You are one of the billions of people who work for the largest of these corporations.

The Weighland-Youthani.

This Corporation had been one of the largest and richest in the entire universe but, after a drastic failure in the Robotic Market, due to some issues with their latest Android series, the Corporation swiftly went back to the Colonization Market, beginning anew to compete with others in the same sector.

You’ve been re-allocated to one of its ships, one with the delicate task to start the process of terraforming a dead planet, making it able to host human life. The ship on which you have taken service is the Nostromo 101, a large space freighter that is transporting the facility needed to start the Terraforming process. It is a long trip, from the Earth Dockyard toward this unnamed planet known only as LV-4287, and for that reason most of your trip should be spent in Hyper-Sleep, with the A.I. of the ship steering on auto pilot toward your destination.

You’ve been assigned to this mission because you’re the best in your field.

You’re the….
1.title: Intro & Characters

12.content:
[Ok, we’re getting somewhere, now time to choose who do you want to be…]

- Dietrich Sturm
Dietrich Sturm, retired Captain of the Colonial Marines.
Dietrich is a veteran with more than twenty mission under his belt, retired from the Marines due to an unacceptable behavior toward those under his command. The guy is a bear of a man, standing at almost two meters of height, while weighing around 250 pounds of, mostly, muscles and fat.
He’s though, harsh and has been often considered merciless, still has a soft spot for those who shows real conviction about their duty, whatever their rank or assignment is. With his short blond hair and his Teutonic physical heritage he could have been a beautiful example of a man, if it wasn’t for his scarred body and face.

- Claire Failleur
Claire is a woman who had had to fight teeth and nails in order to reach the rank of Major in the Earth Defense Force. Being a woman she had to confront a lot of prejudices but she managed showing to have nerves of steel and a conviction made of pure adamantium. Jokingly known to her troops as ‘Major Failure’, she is a strong woman who does all she can to support her troops, expecting them to do the same. With her short stature of almost 1.5 meters from head to toe, even though she hasn’t an outstanding physique, she might seem innocent enough but, more than one officer made the mistake of consider her an easy target when it came to combat practice.

- More choices…
12.title: ...Chief of Security

choices: Issues with the A.I managing the ship
121.content:
[I know, it's a bit short...will recover that on future chapters...]

You lay in your dreamless sleep, having been put there on Earth before the ship departure toward some kind of rock, out in the space.

Suddenly something wakes you up and, even though you’re used to the Hyper Sleep it still takes a few minutes for you to understand what is going on.

With bleary eyes you try to look around but you don’t see much, just some figures moving to and fro around you. Finally, after the dizziness start to calm down you’re enough awake to realize that you’ve been released from Hyper sleep due to…
121.title: The start of the Journey…

choices: 1-	A sudden cry coming from one of the stalls nearby
2-	The electronic voice of the A.I. calling all officers on deck
1211.content:
As you start to feel the dizziness leave your head, you manage to look around and actually see what’s there surrounding you. You’re still in the Waking room, the circular room where all the tubes are gathered by the A.I. to be woken up in batches.

As you watch, you see the other fifteen people of your batch, as they slowly begin to rise from the clutches of the Hyper-Sleep. Among them you spot a solitary figure, already covered in her tight yellow suit with black stripes. Just like a wasp. And just like that bug the woman start buzzing around you, checking the automated scans of your body and your reflex, until you finally manage to close your hand around one of her wrist, stopping her.

“What…What’s…”

You may be awake but your body still need some time to adjust. The woman smiles at you as she frees her wrist from your clutch and turn toward you.

“What’s going on? Well, Chief, seems that the A.I. has woken up all of the high ranking officers. I don’t know yet the reason but it’s no cause for an alarm.

Take your time and wake up for good. Then, we will talk.”

You simply grunt affirmatively as you slowly, push yourself to stand on muscles that have been asleep for the past thirty years. Your gaze cannot leave the figure of the woman, the True Captain of the Vessel, Miranda Goddard. You’ve always found her annoying with her constant cheerfulness but, even you had to admit she was one of the best in maneuvering a freighter of that tonnage.

Shaking your head to clear out the remaining dizziness you manage to stand up and, almost immediately, you begin exercising, doing stretches, sit ups and push-ups. The pain is excruciating, your muscles not yet properly ready for this kind of stress but, you endure it.

Feeling the pain as a long lost friend as you do your routine to be ready for anything in a matter of minutes.

Almost an hour later you’re getting out of the shower, your toned body glistening with the cold water you have used to wash you clean. As you dress yourself with your officer suit you feel pride and shame at the same time. As you dress you can’t stop remembering the time when you were a Colonial Marine.

Sure you knew you were harsh toward your soldiers but, after your training all of them were perfect killing machines.

Of course, you thought, there could have been a couple of deaths during the training but, to have the best you had to take out the weak, hadn’t you?

Still, you were dismissed from the army. With no official note of demerit but, everyone in there knew the truth.

As you buttoned up the last of the buttons on the front of your suit you hear…
1211.title: Issue with the Navigation A.I.

choices: Let him be. You need the job.
12111.content:
You stood in front of the small mirror in your locker, watching yourself deep in thought as a sudden cry came out from one of the shower stalls. As you looked around you noticed to be the last one in and so began moving toward the origin of the sound.

As you got nearer you couldn’t refrain from identifying the moans coming from the shower stall as cry of lust. Feeling angry with yourself for having thought that something was actually happening you made to turn around and exit the room when, behind you, another cry emerged from the stall.

A cry of pain.

Turning back you decided you had enough, if they were actually doing something in there you would have stopped them, as in violation of the regulation on board.

If they weren’t, you would have finally understood what was going on.

Stepping near the shower stall you knocked politely on the door and addressed whoever was inside.

“Security Check. Identify yourselves.”

You heard some agitated whispers coming from the shower, until a male voice emerged, stating that everything was normal, no need for any of that.

Playing it cool, you smirked as you kept the façade of being just a rookie.

“Sorry Sir, regulation have to be observed. Identify yourself and step out of the stall.”

“Look, Rookie, I’m Lieutenant Weighland and I tell you again to get the hell out of here. There is no business here for you. This is a ‘friendly discussion’ I’m having with this...this 'lady' right here.

Now, scram. Regulations are for the fools like yourself…”


Lieutenant Weighland.

You know of him, you were debriefed on having him as your second in command.

One of the most pampered and spoiled kids on the universe, one of the grandson of the old Boss Man himself. They had debriefed you on tutoring him into a man, while treating him with a glove and giving him whatever he wanted, when he wanted to.

Still, you could hear the whimpering of the unknown woman inside the stall, probably being assaulted by the Boss Grandson. These kind of situation always sent you in a rage but, in this case any action against the young man would have ended, probably, in you losing the job.

What do you do?
12111.title: Crying for help

choices: 1-	It’s Annika Lucerna, the Lead Researcher
2-	It’s Miranda Goddard, the Ship Captain
121111.content:
Those words, uttered so casually by that useless lump of meat burned through your very core.

‘Regulations are for the fools like yourself’

Without thinking, as a cold rage washed over you, you slammed open the shower door and grabbed the young lieutenant by the neck throwing him out, as you slammed close the stall door. The guy was barely on his feet that you were already onto him, grabbing him on the shoulders as you kneeded him in his most sensitive parts. As he cried out in pain, you grabbed him by the neck and pushed him against the lockers, keeping him there, partially lifted from the ground.

“I don’t care who you are. You could be the son of the President of the US for all I care, but I will not turn my head as a little shit like you destroy the reputation of the Security personnel on this ship.

Do you know who I am? Do you?”

As he kept muttering obscenities toward you, while trying to pry you hand away from his neck, you pushed him again against the lockers, forcing him to gasp in pain.
“My name is Dietrich Sturm, Chief of Security for the Terraforming Facility.

Your Boss.

And while your parents, your grandfather and all of his advocates are on Earth, you are now living with me, here. And for the remaining five years you’ll be here, under my command.

I don’t like bullies, they’re weak.

So, I catch you again doing this kind of thing to someone, or being disrespectful to someone, I’ll kick your ass so hard you won’t be walking anytime soon.

Did I make myself clear?”

As you released him, he fell onto the floor gasping for air, looking at you with hatred in his eyes.

“Hate me all you want, kid. It will only make me happier to crush you down.”

You started to move toward the shower stall to verify how the girl was when you suddenly turned your head, staring at you second in disgust and with a sadistic grin.

“Clean yourself up, Lieutenant. Oh, and report to my office after you’ve done it. I’ll give you there your punishment for breaking several of the regulations of this vessel.
Go. NOW!”

As he scurried off, staring daggers at your back, you focused on the stall, looking away as you opened the door.

“Miss? Chief of Security Sturm, here. Are you in need of medical assistance? Shall I call the Doctor?”

The voice from inside replies shakily that it won’t be necessary, as the figure steps out you recognize it immediately…
121111.title: Teaching the bullies

1211112.content:
As the figure emerged from the still misty shower stall, you recognized her immediately. It was none other than Miranda Goddard, the Captain of the vessel. Only at that moment you seem to notice her black and yellow bodysuit thrown on the ground and, trying to be less invasive as you could, you bent to pick them up. Offering them to the woman who still hadn’t gotten completely out of the shower.

“Ah…Chief, thanks for the…help.”

“Er…No problem, Ma’am.”

The silence between the two of you is suddenly broken by her, still shaking, voice as she explain what happened, as if just telling it to someone could lift a heavy weight off her shoulders.

“After I had checked for your status, Chief, I went to check the status of the other officers and then…Then I had to wake up also the Lieutenant Weighland. As we started talking he seemed an ok guy, a little bit funny, a little bit horn-dog but ok.

As I was leaving the Waking area he called to me and told me there was something wrong with his suit.
As a fool, I even worried myself and went to check…He told me to meet him in the showers for he didn’t want the others to see…So I went…Then he…Then he…”

You see as the woman cover her eyes with her hands, as tears begin to fall from her eyes.

“Then he…He pushed me on my knees, grabbed my head in one hand and he open up his suit, his ...his..it was no more than a a few inches away from my face…I…I tried to fight him off but…”

You stop her from proceeding further, you already knew how things had to have proceeded from there.
As you stood there, one hand on her shoulder, you realized at the last moment she was crying as she grabbed at your hand, as if it could comfort her.

You were in conflict.

From one side you were irritated from this weakling of an officer. How could she have survived one of the missions you had endured in your career if she was so easy to break down? How could you trust her to command the ship if a crisis was to come your way?
You couldn’t.

At the same time, though, you had never been through that kind of pain. That kind of violation.

You were no fool, you knew that the human body was a perfect machine and that the will alone couldn’t stop your body reactions if external stimuli were strong enough. You thought about how could it feel to be force to that while, your brain, refused the idea.

How would you feel in knowing that as you were repelled in doing something, that same something got your body excited? Could you really blame the woman for feeling so utterly devastated?

More importantly, what were you going to do with her ?
1211112.title: A shaken Captain

choices: 1-	“…we have encountered an unknown object in space, which may be explored”
2-	“…We’ve been hit by a small meteor shower and we need to do some repairs
12111121.content:
You knew to be harsh, to be though and sometimes considered merciless. But you weren’t. Not completely.
Without a word, you opened up your arms, hugging the woman in front of you, as she cried in anguish, releasing all of her pain, all of her torment about what she had to suffer.
After a while, though, she stopped crying and, gently, eased her hold on you, letting your arms free her from the hug. As you looked at her you realized she wasn’t weak, quite the opposite.

She gave you her back for less than a minute and, when she turned again, she seemed fine, as if nothing had happened.

“Thanks, Chief Sturm. I…I really needed that.”

“No problem, Ma’am. And if he dare come back at you, please to inform me immediately.”

“What? Are…Are you sure, Chief? You surely know who he is?”

You grinned as you crunched your knuckles loudly.

“Don’t care. He’s alone out here. Alone with me. it will take years before we can be reached by Earth so…plenty of time to teach him a lesson or two.

Now, Ma’am, I suggest we go at our own desks. There is lots to do and we still have to understand the reason for Freya to have woken us up.”

Soon enough the two of you separated, Miranda going toward the navigational section, as you moved through the corridors toward the Security office. As you were there you were pleasantly surprised in seeing your assistant already at work.

The short woman was already at her desk, organizing the passenger list and checking their identities and their current status.

As you watched her single mindedness from the door way you were mesmerized by her composure. It was already six years the two of you were working together as Chief and Assistant, but only in the last two your relationship with her had changed somewhat. Both of you were driven by your own sense of duty.

Yours toward rules, regulations and orders.

Hers toward the only family she had ever had, the Army, and you.

At the beginning, when she had been just a private, and you were a Sargent, she was extremely loyal to the Corp. and their officers. But, as time went on, and your training regime became more and more hard, she seemed to understand your motivations, your need of making the training so hard so that she and all the others would have been ready for anything on a battlefield.

So when the day came that you were dismissed from the Colonial Marines, she managed to follow you, as her emotions of loyalty and devotion to you started to become something deeper.

As you get out of the flashback, you cough loudly, making your presence noted, as you step inside and sit at your desk. Almost at the same time she stand from her own and bring to you some of the documents and checklists she had been checking earlier.

“Chief, here the list of the passengers who have been released from Hyper-Sleep and the list with the status of each passenger still in Hyper-Sleep. Also, your new Lieutenant has passed from here. He seemed rather…disheveled for some reason.

And, there is a communication from the bridge. Your presence has been requested on Deck in one hour, Sir.”

“Thank you Rosalita. I guess I’ll go, if there is nothing else…?”

The girl stare at you for a second, as if she wanted to inform you of something but then says nothing, saluting you and returning to her station, busying herself with what work there is available. As you finish reading what papers are on your desk, you rise and go outside in the corridor, walking calmly toward the main bridge, where a special meeting for the high ranking officer has been called.

As you get there, you see that all the department leaders are present, along with a few specialist, and so you stand near the wall of the circular meeting room as Captain Goddard explain the reason for the meeting.

Miranda Goddard was again in her black and yellow bodysuit, standing near the meeting table as all the officers on board sat around the table, waiting for an explanation of the situation.

“Ladies, Gentlemen, I’ve called this meeting to inform you of a very special situation we’re facing.

First of all, we are not arrived yet at our final destination. As per our calculation we’re almost halfway there, as of now.”
At this every person in the meeting room began to shout asking question and creating a cacophony of sounds as the Captain tried to silence them all. You move forward and, reached the meeting table, slam your meaty hand against the table surface, silencing everyone, as everyone stared at you.

“Order, people. Let the Captain speak. Question time will be later. Captain, the floor is yours.”

“Thanks Chief Sturm.

As I was saying, Freya woke us up much earlier than forecasted and, as per our investigation, it did it only due to an emergency it wasn’t able to resolve on its own.

As we verified the situation we can tell you that…”
12111121.title: When the Tough guy shows the soft spot

choices: A few days later, as repairs are proceeding
One week later, one of the maintenance start snooping around the restricted area
121111212.content:
Captain Miranda Goddard stood motionless as the news was given to all the high ranking officers. For almost a minute nobody spoke, until the question came out, slowly and tentative.

“Is…Is it grave?”

“Fortunately, no. It’s not a damage that pose an immediate threat to our welfare but, if left alone, it could become something more serious.

Now, I’ll pass the chair to Chief Taggart, Maintenance Crew Leader. Tag?”

Brick Taggart rose slowly from his chair. A round bellied irish man, always dressed in some grease stained coverall and with a small black bowler hat on his head. The guy was always slow and methodical, and had always a solution for any problem related to the maintenance of the ship.

“Alright, here’s the situation. We have some minor breaches in the external hull of the Terraforming facility. As they are they won’t be a problem, since the Facility itself was sealed air tight for the transportation. So no loss of oxygen.

Trouble is if we leave them as they are.

For now they are minor but they could grow larger with the pression applied from the Hyperspace jump and weaken the entire structure. I don’t need to remind you all that if something happens to that facility, we will be stuck once we reach LV-4287.

Now, I would like to request the waking up of my team, in order to proceed with the reparations. I must say I haven’t yet been there, so I cannot say for sure, but I think at least two to three weeks of works, to get everything done.”

“Three Weeks!?” The Lead researcher, Doctor Gene Raspberry, exclaimed in stupor and anger. “We can’t sat here for three weeks, as the maintenance crew plays mechanics!”

“If you want to take my place” said Taggart “Be my guest.”

“Tag?” The voice of Miranda Goddard interrupted the discussion between the Irish and the lead researcher before becoming more physical.

“Tag, are you sure you need three weeks? Won’t two be enough?”

“Well, to complete the job even one week could be enough. Main issue here are the breaches. If we miss even one, it will create problems later on. I guess we could try with two, pushing a little bit, with some guaranteed overtime…”

“I’ll see what can be scrounged up, Tag. Good, if there is nothing else I…”

“Excuse me, Captain?” you intervened.

“Yes? Chief Sturm?”

You step forward, as all the eyes turns to you.

“Ma’am, Need to request for more of my personnel to be woken up.”

“Why? I don’t see…”

“It’s standard procedure. I can’t let anyone wander in the Terraforming Facility without supervision. Depending on Taggart teams, I’ll need at the very least one of mine for each team going inside the Facility.”

“Chief, is it really necessary? We will have to use more of our stored supplies, the more people we wake up.”

“I’m sorry, Ma’am. But those are the Orders I received from the Corporation. No one, except the selected authorized personnel, can access to the facility without supervision.

I understand the need for these repairs but, I must follow what orders had been given to me.”
121111212.title: A not so nice shower...

choices: Let the door unguarded and spoke about it loudly at the next meeting
1211112121.content:
In the following days, five reparations teams moved through the air-tight Terraforming Facility, each followed and supervised by two members of the security.

Everything seemed to go smoothly until, one day, one of the Reparation teams found themselves blocked by the very security guys that were following them.




You were in your office, seated at the desk, verifying the routes that the maintenance crews were following in the Terraforming Facility, when Brick Taggart stormed in your office growling like a feral beast, quickly followed by Captain Goddard.

“What does it mean that MY guys are being held in YOUR cells!?”

“Mr. Taggart, I was expecting you.” You reply, calmly, before continuing “Your people tried to access a restricted area by threatening the security representative with a welding torch.

I couldn’t allow it, could I? For the moment they’re just being held in custody for one night only. Tomorrow morning they will be released.”

Taggart seemed to deflate in front of you. Both of you knew that the punishment was way inferior to what should have been given in a normal situation but, still the Captain objected.

“Chief, I understand your motivation but, what worries me is the fact that there may be a breach behind that door and we can’t verify it because your people are preventing us access.”

“Captain, with all due respect, do I ever question your navigation skill or the route established for this Freighter? No, It’s not my job to question you.

Same issue here. My orders are to prevent access to those areas from anyone, unless their access codes are equal or above Vermillion Security check.

As far as I know, there are very few people here who have those access. And neither of you is one of them.

Sorry, but I must stand on this point.”

“But, Chief, the entire Facility could be in danger…”

“I understand that. And I would like to help.

If I could I would send all of my guys shadowing the maintenance crew at all times in those areas. But the orders are clear. No entrance for any reason, except for those few authorized users.

I can’t disobey my orders.”

As both the Captain and the Maintenance Leader went out of your office, you noticed Rosalita looking at you strangely.

“What?”

“Aren’t you worried, Dietrich? If there is a breach down there and we do nothing about it…we could be blasted to oblivion as we are back into Hyper-Sleep.”


You mull it over.

Yes, it’s a true danger but orders are to be followed. Still, you could always let the door to the restricted area be unguarded for a few hours in order to let someone go and check but, even you are not aware of what’s sealed behind those doors.

And if something goes wrong, only you would have the blame…

What do you do?
1211112121.title: As reparations proceed, a new problem arise…

choices: Something hits you pretty hard[change of POV]
You hear something banging, on the other side of the door
12111121212.content:
As you mulled over it, you finally reached a decision.

Standing from your desk you went and gave Rosalita a small peck on her cheek. The girl looked at you confused, not used to this kind of demonstration, when not in the privacy of your own room
.
“Thanks, my little Rosa, to remind me to be more human. I’m off to check a few things. See you for dinner?”

“Sure, Chief. At dinner and…after dinner…”

As you left the office you went directly to wear the protection suit needed to access the Terraforming Facility, which was still sealed with no air whatsoever.

As you passed the security gates you had requested, you confirmed your will to inspect personally whatever was behind those doors. If it was safe, then, you would have agreed on having someone coming with you to search for any breaches.

If it wasn’t…then you would have to had a rapid course on how to detect breaches.

As you reached the door to the restricted area you motioned to the guards standing there to let you pass, as they complied you got nearer to the door until you could flash your authorization keycard, opening the restricted area so that you could start check what was inside.

As the door closed behind you, locking itself, you began asking yourself why hadn’t you let those damn maintenance guys in there instead of coming personally. The place gave you the creeps.

You moved in the restricted area, seeing lots of laboratories, but no proof of anything suspicious. You were almost ready to go back and bring the guys in when you noticed a huge stainless steel door closing off a section of the restricted area.

As you looked at the door, trying to figure out what could be in there that need that kind of protection…
12111121212.title: Taking the risk yourself, before exposing others

121111212121.content:
As you looked at the door, trying to figure out what could be in there that need that kind of protection, you notice only at the last minute a shadow moving behind you.

As fast as you try to turn around, the figure hits you first on the head and your vision slowly become confused.

For a moment, all you can think of is Rosalita and the dinner you wanted to have together but then a sudden darkness surge, engulfing you as you fell unconscious on the floor.

************


That evening Rosalita was sitting in Dietrich room, the small table already prepared with what could be thought as a lovely dinner for the standard of a space freighter.

The girl was dressed with a long red dress, one she knew Dietrich loved…and which he loved getting her out of.

Strangely though, the Security Chief hadn’t yet arrived and Rosa was trying to understand what could have kept him away. As she silently waited, sipping from her wine glass, she tried to think if there was a meeting or an emergency for which he could have been called for but, nothing seemed out of the ordinary.

As the delay had reach the hour and half, the girl finally decided to contact the Captain, in order to see if her boss, and fiancée, was there.

“Operator? Agent Cisneros, requesting contact with Captain Goddard. Thanks.”

After a few minutes of waiting the tired voice of Miranda Goddard came out of the speaker linked to the cabin intercom.

“Agent? Agent Cisneros?”

“Yes, Captain. Sorry for disturbing you as of this late.”

“It’s ok, was just finishing up some reports. What can I do for you, Agent?”

“Could you please tell Mr. Sturm that although being fashionably late can be exciting…it is not making a good impression now?”

“Mr. Sturm? Why…I mean…He’s not here. I haven’t seen him since this morning.”

Rosalita now was very worried.

Where Dietrich could have gone and what could have happened that he forgot to come back?

The voice of Miranda brought Rosalita beck into the real world.

“Why, Agent, Chief Sturm is not in his office?”

“N-No…He…he said he had a few things to check some ten minutes after meeting with you and Mr. Taggart. But after that I haven’t seen him anymore.
Could…Could you…?”

“Starting a scan check on the ship…now.

…

Ship’s clean. He’s not on board. Terraforming Facility next.

Hold on.

…

This is strange.”

“Captain? W-What is strange?”

“I have here his access to the restricted area on the Facility this morning but…But he seemed to have never gotten out of there.

My scans can’t perform over those areas but, I don’t have his name on the log-out from the Facility.

What has he gone there to do?”

Rosa knew the answer.

“He went to check personally if he could let Mr. Taggart people inside.

He had told me something this morning, something about being more…human.

Oh, god…What if something happened to him?”

“Well…” Miranda said over the intercom “what could get down a bear like that? He probably just got busy with some procedures…maybe some decontamination process? Don’t worry, Miss, I’m sure he’s fine. You’ll see him coming back in a few moments. I’m sure of it.”

Rosalita closed the intercom and sat again, waiting, waiting for her lover to be back from wherever he was.
Hoping he was alright.
121111212121.title: A plunge into darkness

choices: “… Dangerous Breach detected in Terraforming Facility, Sub-level  5.”
"… Unknown life form Detected in Terraforming Facility, Sub Level 2.”
1211112121212.content:
You opened your eyes slowly. Everything seemed so confused, where were you?
What was happening?

You weren’t sure. Maybe you had just woke up from the Hyper-Sleep?

Suddenly your memories returned and you remembered where you was. The restricted area. Where something had attacked you and, evidently, knocked you unconscious.

As your vision returned to normal, you could see yourself strapped to a chair, a fierce light blazing in front of you, making you blind. Your arms were constricted, as were your legs.

What was going on?

“I See Someone Has Woken Up.”

A voice came from behind the blinding light, calm and controlled.

“I Wonder Who Are You? And How You Got Inside? There Should Not Be Anyone Awake.

So Why Are You Here?”

“Who the Hell Are you! And what are you doing on the Ship I am guarding!”

“You Are Guarding This Ship? Yes…I See Now…Voice Identification Confirmed…Dietrich Sturm, Security Chief…Vermillion Access Authorized. “

As the voice finished speaking so the light turned off and the straps from the chair opened up, releasing you.

“Sorry For The Rough Treatment. Needed To Know Who You Were. I Am Andy, W-Y Corporate Android Researcher, In Charge Of This Area.”

Now that the blinding light had been turned off you could see more clearly the figure. It was covered in some kind of Synthetic skin which gave him an almost normal look but, if you watched closer you could see that he wasn’t human.

His body structure was too perfect, as was his face. All immaculate skin with no hint of age or any deficiency. He was a too perfect human specimen to be reasonably human.

“Now, Please To State Your Business In This Area.”

“Freya woke us up a couple of weeks ago, we have been hit by a meteor shower and several small breaches were found throughout the Terraforming Facility.

Since non authorized personnel couldn’t come in here, I came personally to verify if everything was in order. Until we are a hundred per cent sure that no breaches are still open, we cannot leave.”

The android seemed to mull it over for not eve a couple of moments before turning his head toward you, his voice always calm and controlled.

“I See. No Breaches In This Area…Although, I Have Detected Some Unknown Biological Residual In The Accessible Section Of The Facility.

I Would Have Liked To Investigate But, My Orders Are to Stay Here Hidden While Keeping These Labs Secure.

As Such, I Would Like For You To Leave And Keep My Existence A Secret. Unless Emergencies Should Arise, Of Course.”

As you were going to say something, the entire laboratory was immersed in a glowing red light as a siren began to screech all around you. As you planted your hands on your ears, you tried to ask to the android what was going on but, before any of you could speak the electronic voice of Freya boomed from the speakers in all the ship and the Facility.

“Warning. Security Alert. ….
1211112121212.title: Trapped?

choices: Return fire and find your team
12111121212122.content:
As soon as you emerged from the restricted section, you could see that it was madness.

The corridors filled with that ghastly red light as Freya’s voice kept booming all around you, the guards posted near the door were gone, leaving you there alone.

As you went to check the radio you heard the voice of Captain Goddard on the intercom, as the screeching siren was shut off.

“This is Captain Miranda Goddard. This is not a drill. All personnel not on the security checklist is to return immediately to the docking area for boarding on the Nostromo. I repeat, all non-security personnel is to return to the docking area of the Nostromo.”

You were now confused, what was going on?

Taking the radio you contacted the Captain herself for a status update.

“Captain Goddard? Chief Sturm here. Situation?”

The radio crackled alive with the, almost hysterical, voice of the woman.

“Sturm!? Where were you? Anyway, doesn’t matter now.

We’ve got traces of an unknown life form quickly speeding through the sub level 2 in the Facility. It seemed to have attacked one of the maintenance crew as he was performing some repairs.

We have no confirmation yet but it seems to be some kind of slug. Be extremely careful out there, whatever it is, it burned through the protection suit of the victim with ease. You security personnel is on the chase.

I see it here on the monitor and I cannot believe it is so fast.”

“Thanks Captain, I will give you a full report once the situation will be back to normal. Over and out.”

As you shut the radio you quickly changed channel and put yourself in contact with your team. They were trying to follow the creature but it seemed it was very cunning and able to find passages were there shouldn’t have been one. Running as fast as you could with the heavy-set protection suit you tried to reach your team only to find one of them standing in a three way check point.

“Private? Identify yourself.”

The guard turned toward your voice, with the stun gun ready to fire, only to stop and lower the weapon slightly as she recognized your personal protection suit.

“Oh, Commander Sturm. Private Jane Kowsky, Sir.”

“Status Report, Jane.”

The girl turned around, resuming her duties as the lookout, began speaking slowly as she tried to be as alert as she could, while speaking.

“It’s fast Sir. It’s darn fast that thing. Team Alpha and Bravo are following it, while Charlie has been deployed to circle the area and prevent it to leave the area.

We’re spread out thin, Commander. And Alpha & Bravo, are trying their best but they cannot follow it under the walls.”

“What is it, Private? Have you seen it?”

“Seen it?....Yeah. Was with the maintenance team when it attacked. The guy was just welding the breach when from nowhere this… thing…jumped from the ceiling and missed the guy’s head for a heartbeat. Still burned through the armor like an acid.

The poor fella almost lost his arm.

It’s some kind of slug, you can’t miss it, Sir. It’s a bright light green beast. Long at most, half a meter. It seems to be responding only to stun discharges. Fire doesn’t do anything to it.”

“What do you mean? Private?”

The girl, still checking each of the corridors in the crossroads, didn’t answer immediately.

“The maintenance guy…he tried to fend it off with his welding torch.

It didn’t work.
…
That slug ran away when I zapped it with my stun gun, though. It hasn’t stopped yet, Sir.”

Thanking the woman, you took out your stun pistol, basically a small pistol capable of shooting small electrical charged pellets, and entered one of the corridors, trying to out maneuver the alien form as it was pressed from the other two teams from behind.

As you proceed forward, gun at the ready, you suddenly are forced to get down, as a couple of electrical pellets explodes against the corridor wall behind you.

“Friendly fire! Cease fire!” you shout at the top of your lungs, as the pellets starts to get more precise toward your position.

As you lay on the floor, trying to cover yourself as much as you can, you think you hear a muffled sound and a whimper, coming from the threeway crossing behind you.

You could get back and investigate what that sound was, but you’ll leave what cover you have and will have to risk to be shot at. Or you could fire in the other corridor, showing that you’re part of the crew, at least, and not the slug.

What do you do?
12111121212122.title: Roaming beast in a maze…

choices: There is pulse. She’s weak but alive.
121111212121222.content:
You had no time for any investigation. It was time to show to those idiots why you were the best.

Slithering on the floor, you manage to get at some sort of cover behind the angle of the corridor then, with your free hand you grab your flash grenade and throw it with expert movements against the wall angle, sending it flying right where they were shooting you. As you heard the Flashbang go, you rapidly move and literally grab at the first guy on your path as you tackle him to the ground, his stun gun flying away from his grasp.

Between the tackle and the flashbang, the guy is in no shape to say or do anything. Only now, as they stopped shooting, you realize who you have tackled to the ground.

Your ‘beloved’ Lieutenant Weighland.

With a grin, you stand from the ground, accidentally kicking him on the face, as you moved toward your team, led by one of your most experienced Non-Coms.

“Sargent Fulkrum! Chief Sturm here, stop shooting!”

“Cease Fire, Alpha, Bravo! Cease fire! It’s the Commander!”

When the situation had been cleared, you manage to reach the corridor where the two teams were gathering when someone had begun shooting at you.

“So, Sargent, what is the situation?”

“Sir. We were following that blasted thing, but when we reached the corridor entryway someone called for movement and we all started shooting, Sir. I will take full responsibility, Sir.”

You looked at the man in front of you. Old and yet spry, even though there was more fat than muscles on his body, still he was an experienced soldier, one who would do anything to protect his men. Still, he was far too experienced to let something like this happen. Even with a bunch of fresh recruits.

It had happened, though, and that could mean only one thing. He was covering for his own, yes, but also for someone else. Your eyes turn toward the forms of Lieutenant Weighland, still slumped on the floor, as two men were currently trying to wake him up.

“Sargent. Inform the men that for the next two weeks, if we are still here, there will be a ban on booze for all. Also, an additional two hours of cleaning weaponry in the armory everyday should give them all the experience they want with their weapons.
That is all, Sargent.”

“Yes, Sir!”

As you turned around you noticed the recruits sending you glares with their eyes, when they thought you weren’t watching.

‘Fools’ you thought ‘You could all be court-martialed for what you did.
For what your unit commander has started.’

You had reasoned it well enough, the young lieutenant was probably behind all this, especially since he had been firing himself when you had stopped him. Still, you couldn’t chew him out in front of everyone. It would have been bad for the teams for that to happen.

Men who don’t respect their commanders will never perform at their best.

Now that the situation was resolved, you sent the Lieutenant away with a couple of soldiers for the med bay, as you took the charge of the teams, and proceeded to go toward the same way you had come. If they were following the ‘slug’, it was probable that it had gotten away during the little shoot-out.

As you reached the crossway, you immediately noticed the slumped form of Private Kowski on the ground. Her suit burned up to a crisp, leaving most of her upward torso without protection. As you kneeled near her, the rest of your guards, began taking positions around you, ready to cover you and the fallen companion.

You check her for a pulse and you notice right away that…
121111212121222.title: Shooting Range

choices: Let the corpse stay there and bring your men home
Delay the lockdown as you drag the coffin, risking an alien outbreak
1211112121212221.content:
You notice right away that she’s alive. As soon as your hand grab hers, she open slowly her eyes, as she mutter toward you.

“H-Hey…B-Boss…”

You clench her hands in yours as you motion her to stay down.

“Rest easy, Private. We’re getting out of here.”

Sargent Fulkrum turned toward you speechless as he herd you.

“Sir!? We will let that thing escape us?...Never!”

You let go of her hand as you stand up and turn to face your Sargent, looking him directly into the eyes, letting him see the barely controlled fury his insubordination had caused within you.

You can see he now realize what he has done, admitting in front of all that he was ready to confront your orders and he started to speak but you cut him off with such a hard tone that even the other guards rigidly snapped to attention.

“Sargent!” you roared “Was that a hint of mutiny in your words? Shall I make it clear that it is I who give the orders here? Or shall I believe that the old age is making you sloppy?”

This was a low blow, you knew it, Sargent Fulkrum knew it and so did most of the other guards. But what the guards didn’t know was that both you and the Sargent were aware of necessity for this scene.

For that it was, more or less.

You trusted the old Sargent as if he was your own brother but, he had involuntarily diminished your authority in front of all the recruits and, even though you were probably going to be remembered as a tyrannical dictator, you had to give such a show of strength that nobody of them would had never found the nerve, and guts, of challenging your commands.

“Sir!” Sargent Fulkrum answered, while standing at attention.

“Stand down, Fulkrum. Escort Private Kowsky to the medbay and then get back to the barracks and stay there for the night. Tomorrow morning, at oh six hundred I want you in My Office, full uniform regalia.

Do You Understand Your Orders, Sargent?”

“Sir, Yessir!”

As the Sargent lifted the slumped form of the wounded private you noticed that there was some kind of dark green slime on the private face. You could have stopped it, but there were more pressing needs to be taken care of, so you told yourself to look into it later and put that information away as you concentrated on the situation at hand, while grabbing your radio.

“Captain Goddard? Chief Sturm here. What is the situation with the evacuation?”

“All non-security personnel evacuated, Chief. Have you managed to get that slug?”

“Negative. I’ve got at the very least two men down. We’re spread too thin and there is too much area to cover. We’re retreating in order to re-organize.

Captain? Ask Freya to initialize Code Oh Nine Oh. Authorization requested by Security Chief Dietrich Sturm.”

“What is that, Chief?”

“A lock down command. All the Terraforming facility will be locked down, section by section, floor by floor. I can’t follow that blasted creature…but I don’t want her to run around either.

Give us five minutes and initialize the command.

Chief Sturm, over and out.”

As you turn around you notice that also the other team had reached you, bringing with them one of their own on a portable litter.

“Corporal? Situation?”

“That damned slug. It pounced on us as we were regrouping. Poor Carlton here didn’t stood a chance. That thing burned through his armor and tried to hide with him inside. When we reached him it was already too late.

The slug was gone but Carlton…He…He didn’t make it, Sir.”

You breathed out in worry. How could a slug be that fast? But those were idle speculations and you hadn’t time to lose on those in that moment.

“Alright, Troopers! Let’s get out of here. In five minutes whatever is staying behind will be locked in here for good. We will regroup, reorganize and tomorrow will be back in action.”

As you started to move toward the exit, your eyes fell on the dead body of Private Jonah Carlton, which was going to be left there, closed in his air tight portable plastic coffin.

As you watched you seemed to notice some kind of gel around his wounds and you wanted to investigate it but, in doing so you would have to delay the lockdown sequence and that alien bastard could manage to escape the Facility.

Otherwise you had to leave the body behind and try to retrieve it on the following day.

What do you do?
1211112121212221.title: Living to fight another day

15.content: Let’s bring some more people in here, shall we?
15.title: ...More choices

151.content:
How about these colorful characters?

Scott Lang is a 25 year old engineer. The son of Chinese immigrants, Lang witnessed a space shuttle takeoff as a child and was fascinated by space travel. Since then he has worked tirelessly to learn all there is about space travel. About six months ago, he was given a position as an engineer aboard a deep-space exploration vessel. When the ship's engine was damaged in a meteor shower, it was his technical skill that saved both ship and crew. Now, he's been entrusted with another crucial mission, this time as chief engineer.

Krista Garraway is a 32 year old Harvard alumni with several degrees in mechanical engineering. She designed the prototype terraforming facility that the Nostromo carries. Born and raised in southern England, the redheaded engineer is very protective of machines, constantly criticising careless crewmates. As a certified genius, she has several jobs on the ship, but mostly prides herself on the work she does to keep the ship flying.

Alexi Zhernov is a burly, bearded Russian in his forties. Tall and muscular, Zhernov looks more like a Russian mobster than an engineer, but he has a delicate touch with machines. Working in his father's repair shop as a child, Zhernov discovered an innate knack for tinkering. The 6'03 engineer speaks somewhat broken English, spending more time learning coding languages than human ones, but he can make himself understood in most scenarios.
151.title: Chief Engineer?

choices: Follow the scientists before they get too far away.
Head back to the engine room and complete your diagnostic.
Talk to the captain about it.
1511.content:
The landing craft hovers its way out of the hangar, propulsion jets emitting a high-pitched wail as it flies towards the surface of the planet. It enters LV-4287's atmosphere, causing great turbulence. The passengers are rocked around, thankful for their safety harnesses, as they ready their minds and bodies for what they will find on the surface below.

Or at least, that's what you imagine is happening on the small shuttle as you watch it from your vid-screen. You're none too keen to go blundering around on such a remote and mostly unexplored planet. You feel much more at home aboard the Nostromo, surrounded by computers and machines.

Sighing, you close out of the video feed and begin running a diagnostic of the ship's inner workings. Knowing it will take roughly half an hour to complete, you decide to head to the mess hall to grab some breakfast. Your stomach rumbles in agreement.

Upon arrival, you find several other crew members have had the same idea as you. A few are your fellow engineers, subordinates on this voyage. Others are familiar to you, but not particularly close, such as the captain and the head of security. Still others you have not bothered yourself with remembering.

Grabbing a bowl of cereal, you sit down at one of several long tables, occupied only by a pair of men wearing the badge of the Research and Science team: a small green beaker over the Weighland-Youthani logo. Your own depicts a silver wrench over the same background, which you feel mischaracterizes your profession, but you assume that the two scientists across from you feel the same about their own emblem.

The two are engaged in a quiet but rather animated discussion, which you strain to hear. You are not, of course, in the habit of eavesdropping, but you are bored this morning, and have to admit that you are rather curious as to what the fuss is all about.

"I'm telling you," the first man, young and fresh-faced, mutters to his compatriot, "The readings check out. This planet isn't uninhabited like the company thought it was! There are native life forms! That's the only logical explanation!"

The other, an older, balding gentleman, pushes his glasses further up the bridge of his nose before grunting dismissively. "You're probably just picking up signs from the colonists. Trust me, Weighland-Youthani doesn't settle planets unless they're sure they can sell the land to settlers. And no one in their right mind moves across the galaxy to a planet with dangerous wildlife. Even if you were picking up native creatures, they're probably harmless."

The younger man frowns thoughtfully. "I suppose, but still, we should send a warning down to the landing party. They need to be careful." He pushed himself away from the table and stood up. "I'll go send the message." He walks to the nearest exit, his white lab coat swaying behind him, and steps through. The older man turns to regard you for a moment before following.

Something doesn't feel quite right to you about the conversation you overheard. It sounds almost as though the colonists, along with the landing party, could be in danger. And the look that the older man gave you...

Still, it's not your place to meddle in the affairs of others, and it might be kind of awkward to explain that you were spying on them, especially if this turned out to be nothing of concern. Perhaps you should just stick to what you know best and head back to the engine.

Or maybe this is worth mentioning to the captain. You're sure that he'd want to know of any potential danger to his crew, and he might be able to help ease your mind about the issue. You could rest easy knowing that he was aware of the situation, though again it could prove sn awkward discussion when you got to how you acquired this information.
1511.title: Chief Engineer Lang, reporting for duty.

choices: You step forward and offer your assistance.
You stay flat against the wall, waiting to see what happens.
15111.content:
Your curiosity piqued, you decide to follow the scientists. Sliding your half-finished bowl of cereal into a sink, you walk quickly down the hallway through which your targets went, hoping to catch some glimpse of them.

Your efforts are rewarded when you see the fluttering of a lab coat disappearing around a corner. You scramble to catch up, slowing once you reach the turn. You peek around the wall to see the younger man fiddling with a vid-screen.

He attempts to turn it in, but is met with a screen full of static. Frustrated, he slams a fist into the command console. "Dammit! Where's Engineering and Repair when you need them? Somebody should fix this damn monitor."

Now might be a good time to join them, the man's outburst giving you a perfect excuse to get involved in whatever you have distracted yourself with. Though it could also prove beneficial to wait and see what happens...
15111.title: Space sleuthing.

choices: Go and get help before it's too late.
151112.content:
While it is tempting to step forward and get involved, the look that the older scientist gave you in the cafeteria is enough to make you stay hidden. Something feels just a little off about him.

The younger man growls st the vid-screen monitor as he types away at the keyboard. After several attempts to restore visual to the display, he smacks it again. "If this damn thing doesn't want to work, we'll just try another one." He turns to look for a new screen, but his partner moves to intercept him.

"Doesn't matter. They won't work." He says quietly, in a matter-of-fact tone. Despite the preposterous nature of his claim, you somehow know he is right.

"What are you talking about?" The younger man demands. He tries to move around, but his bespectacled companion shoves him backwards.

"What I mean to say," He mutters darkly, so low you can barely hear him over the ship's engine, "Is that the ship's entire communication array has been sabotaged."

His empty hand reaches into his lab coat for just a moment. When it emerges, it clutches a wicked looking knife, with a serrated blade that was designed for cutting flesh.

This looks bad, perhaps you should intervene. Though this situation is rather dangerous, perhaps you should call for a Security agent. There's no way you can ignore this now, not with threats of violence and talk of sabotage.
151112.title: Going with your gut.

choices: "Alright, let's get him to Security before anything else happens."
"I'll handle him. You just see if you can get this vid-screen working."
1511121.content:
"Hey!" You call out. Both scientists look in your direction as you step out from behind the wall. The elder of the two brandishes his blade. "I don't know what's going on, but you two need to break it up right now."

"Another one? How many of you damn things are on this ship?" With a growl, the man lunges forward, slashing at you. You barely manage to duck as the blade whizzes over your head.

A foot slams into your stomach, knocking the air out of your lungs and sending you sprawling. In a heartbeat, the scientist is on top of you, blade pressed against your throat.

"D'you bleed, I wonder?" His eyes shine with a fevered excitement as he clutches your collar tighter, and you feel the knife pressing uncomfortably into your skin.

Clang! The man's eyes roll up into the back of his head and he crumples to the ground beside you. Behind him stands his younger compatriot, metal rod gripped tightly in his hand. When he's sure the bespectacled man is out cold, he extends a hand to you, which you gratefully accept. His palms are cold and sweaty.

"Thank you for intervening. I don't know what got into Gerald to make him act like that." He runs the back of his head apologetically. "Sorry about the trouble. I'm David Finch, from Research and Science, but you can call me Dave."

You nod. "I'm Scott Lang, chief of Engineering and Repair." As soon as you identify yourself, Dave's eyes like up.

"Maybe you can take a look at this vid-screen over here, see if you can get it working again. I was trying to send a message to the landing party, but it just wasn't working."

You glance down at the unconscious form of Gerald. "Shouldn't we do something about this guy?"

Dave frowns before replying...
1511121.title: Now seems like a good time.

Welcome to all to this little interactive of mine.

As some of you may have guessed, this is thought as a Spin Off from the marvelous movie saga of “Alien”. In this interactive you’ll have to wear the identity of one of the crew on board of the Nostromo 101 or one of the personnel from the Terraforming facility.

Will everything goes as planned and you will reach the destination without any problems or something will happen during the trip? The W-Y Corp. loves to keep many secrets from its workers, there may be more to this trip than anyone else may think about?

Proceed into the story and, maybe, you’ll find out.


Rules, rules, rules :
- In order to avoid deletion and/or edit to the chapter, please to write more than a few lines for each chapter, in any event I'll try to contact each author before taking any action.

- Some grammar mistakes can be condoned [sheesh, this is not even my language] so I can understand a mistake here or there, but don’t write as if this was a phone text.

- Feel free to adapt the interactive to your story but, leave always a choice for someone else to turn the story in another direction. A simple "something else..." can suffice in most of the cases

- If things will be getting HOT or Violent, please to insert a note in the title " [HOT] / [GORE] / " So that the viewer is advised of what is gonna happen.


Edit:
- Upped the rating to 18+ due to some more gorish detail that will be implemented in future chapters.

- 500 GPs reward for any good chapter added

What else to say? Enjoy the reading and the writing!
